content.description: Start sitting at the bottom of the arete, right at the triangle angle change and left with a nice sidepull.  Climb the obvious and striking feature to the apex.  Good stuff.
content.location: Just below the tree line.  This boulder can be spotted from the South Shore parking lot. Just below Battlewound and Crimp on boulders.

content.description: Start matched on a slopey edge and cruise up and right to top out.  Fun and obvious.
content.location: On right side of Rhombus Boulder.

content.description: Funky little one.  Start matched on a horn, pinching and or meat hooking.  Grapple up and right through slopers and slimpers to get the arete and mantle.
content.location: Just below Battlewound in the talus.  Just below and east of Rhombus boulder by 20/30 feet.  Faces southwest.

content.description: Start at the bottom of the arete, left side pull and right on triangle pinch at the angle change, (same start as Rhombus).  Do a couple moves and mantle on to the slab with finesse.  Finish up the slab.
content.location: Rhombus Boulder.  Just below Battle Cry Area in talus.

content.description: Going straight up from the intersection of the Balanced Rock Trail and Grottos Trail should put you there.  It is 50 feet or so below the tree line.  This pink Rhombus shape boulder can be seen from the South Shore Beach parking lot. Traversing in from Balanced Rock Trail works well also. The problem Crimp On is just above, the prominent Battle Wound boulder is just above and east.
